{{Day}}

It is sometimes celebrated as New Year's Eve (at least in the 20th & 21st centuries) by ethnic groups and religious orders still using the thirteen-days-adrift [[Julian calendar]] ([[Old New Year]]).

==Events==
* [[532]] &ndash; [[Nika riots]] in [[Constantinople]].
* [[888]] &ndash; [[Odo of France|Odo, Count of Paris]] becomes King of the [[Franks]].
*[[1435]] &ndash; ''[[Sicut Dudum]]'', forbidding the enslavement of the [[Guanches|Guanche]] natives in [[Canary Islands]] by the [[Spanish people|Spanish]], is promulgated by [[Pope Eugene IV]].
*[[1547]] &ndash; [[Henry Howard, Earl of Surrey]] is sentenced to death.
*[[1607]] &ndash; The Bank of [[Genoa]] fails after announcement of [[Sovereign default|national bankruptcy]] in [[Spain]].
*[[1666]] &ndash; French traveller [[Jean-Baptiste Tavernier]] arrived [[Dhaka]] and met [[Shaista Khan]].
*[[1793]] &ndash; [[Nicolas Jean Hugon de Bassville]], representative of [[Revolutionary France]], lynched by a mob in [[Rome]]
*[[1797]] &ndash; [[French Revolutionary Wars]]: A [[Action of 13 January 1797|naval battle]] between a French [[ship of the line]] and two British frigates off the coast of [[Brittany]] ends with the French vessel running aground, resulting in over 900 deaths.
*[[1815]] &ndash; [[War of 1812]]: [[British Empire|British]] troops capture [[Battle of Fort Peter|Fort Peter]] in [[St. Marys, Georgia]], the only battle of the war to take place in the state.
*[[1822]] &ndash; The design of the [[Flag of Greece|Greek flag]] is adopted by the [[First National Assembly at Epidaurus]].
*[[1830]] &ndash; The Great fire of [[New Orleans|New Orleans, Louisiana]] begins.
*[[1833]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|President]] [[Andrew Jackson]] writes to [[Vice President of the United States|Vice President]] [[Martin Van Buren]] expressing his opposition to [[South Carolina]]'s defiance of federal authority in the [[Nullification Crisis]].
*[[1840]] &ndash; The steamship ''[[Steamship Lexington|Lexington]]'' burns and sinks four miles off the coast of [[Long Island]] with the loss of 139 lives.
*[[1842]] &ndash; Dr. [[William Brydon]], an assistant surgeon in the British [[East India Company]] Army during the [[First Anglo-Afghan War]], becomes famous for being the [[Massacre of Elphinstone's Army|sole survivor of an army]] of 4,500 men and 12,000 [[camp follower]]s when he reaches the safety of a garrison in [[Jalalabad|Jalalabad, Afghanistan]].
*[[1847]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Cahuenga]] ends the [[Mexican–American War]] in [[California]].
*[[1869]] &ndash; National convention of black leaders meets in [[Washington, D.C.]]
*[[1893]] &ndash; The [[Independent Labour Party]] of the [[United Kingdom]] holds its first meeting.
*  1893  &ndash; [[United States Marine Corps|U.S. Marines]] land in [[Honolulu|Honolulu, Hawaii]] from the {{USS|Boston|1884|6}} to prevent the queen from abrogating the [[1887 Constitution of the Kingdom of Hawaii|Bayonet Constitution]].
*[[1898]] &ndash; [[Émile Zola]]'s ''[[J'accuse]]'' exposes the [[Dreyfus affair]].
*[[1908]] &ndash; The [[Rhoads Opera House]] fire in [[Boyertown, Pennsylvania]] kills 171 people.
*[[1910]] &ndash; The [[Birth of public radio broadcasting|first public radio broadcast]] takes place; a live performance of the opera ''[[Cavalleria rusticana]]'' is sent out over the airwaves from the [[Metropolitan Opera House (39th St)|Metropolitan Opera House]] in [[New York City|New York, New York]].
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[Delta Sigma Theta]] Sorority Incorporated was founded on the campus of Howard University.
*[[1915]] &ndash; An [[1915 Avezzano earthquake|earthquake in Avezzano]], [[Italy]] kills 29,800.
*[[1934]] &ndash; The [[Candidate of Sciences]] degree is established in the [[Soviet Union]].
*[[1935]] &ndash; A [[Referendum|plebiscite]] in [[Saar (League of Nations)|Saarland]] shows that 90.3% of those voting wish to join [[Nazi Germany]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; The [[Black Friday (1939)|Black Friday]] bush fires burn 20,000 square kilometers of land in [[Australia]], claiming the lives of 71 people.
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[Henry Ford]] patents a [[plastic]] [[automobile]], which is 30% lighter than a regular car.
*  1942   &ndash; [[World War II]]: First use of an aircraft [[ejection seat]] by a [[Germany|German]] test pilot in a [[Heinkel He 280]] jet fighter.
*[[1951]] &ndash; [[First Indochina War]]: The [[Battle of Vinh Yen]] begins, which will end in a major victory for [[France]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; An article appears in ''[[Pravda]]'' accusing some of the most prestigious and prominent doctors, mostly [[Jews]], in the Soviet Union of taking part in a [[Doctors' plot|vast plot]] to poison members of the top Soviet political and military leadership.
*[[1958]] &ndash; The [[Moroccan Army of Liberation]] ambushes a Spanish patrol in the [[Ifni War|Battle of Edchera]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; Anti-[[Muslim]] riots break out in Calcutta, resulting in 100 deaths.
*  1964   &ndash; Karol Wojtyla, the future [[Pope John Paul II]], is appointed [[archbishop]] of [[Kraków|Kraków, Poland]].
*[[1966]] &ndash; [[Robert C. Weaver]] becomes the first [[African American]] Cabinet member when he is appointed [[United States Secretary of Housing and Urban Development]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Johnny Cash]] [[At Folsom Prison|performs live]] at [[Folsom State Prison]]
*[[1972]] &ndash; Prime Minister [[Kofi Abrefa Busia]] and President [[Edward Akufo-Addo]] of [[Ghana]] are ousted in a bloodless [[Coup d'état|military coup]] by Colonel [[Ignatius Kutu Acheampong]].
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Archbishop Seraphim of Athens|Seraphim]] is elected [[List of archbishops of Athens|Archbishop of Athens and All Greece]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; [[U.S.]] [[Food & Drug Administration]] requires all [[blood donations]] to be labeled "paid" or "volunteer" donors.
*[[1982]] &ndash; Shortly after takeoff, [[Air Florida Flight 90]], a Boeing 737 jet crashes into Washington, D.C.'s [[14th Street Bridge (Potomac River)|14th Street Bridge]] and falls into the [[Potomac River]], killing 78 including four motorists.
*[[1985]] &ndash; A passenger train plunges into a ravine in [[Ethiopia]], killing 428 in the worst railroad disaster in Africa.
*[[1986]] &ndash; A month-long violent struggle begins in [[Aden|Aden, South Yemen]] between supporters of [[Ali Nasir Muhammad]] and [[Abdul Fattah Ismail]], resulting in thousands of casualties.
*[[1988]] &ndash; [[Lee Teng-hui]] becomes the first [[Taiwanese people|native Taiwanese]] [[President of the Republic of China]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Douglas Wilder]] becomes the first elected African American governor as he takes office in [[Richmond, Virginia]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; Soviet Union troops [[January Events (Lithuania)|attack]] [[Lithuania]]n independence supporters in [[Vilnius]], killing 14 people and wounding 1000.
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[Space Shuttle program]]: [[Space Shuttle Endeavour|''Endeavour'']] heads for space for the third time as [[STS-54]] launches from the [[Kennedy Space Center]].
*[[2001]] &ndash; An [[2001 El Salvador earthquakes#The January 13 earthquake|earthquake]] hits [[El Salvador]], killing more than 800.
*[[2012]] &ndash; The passenger [[cruise ship]] ''[[Costa Concordia]]'' [[Costa Concordia disaster|sinks]] off the coast of [[Italy]]. There are 31 confirmed deaths with one still missing, Russel Rebello, amongst the 4232 passengers and crew.
